name: AB Progression Mechanics - problems in Dragon Shape?
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I've started this thread because I was interested to see if Piercing DR /- would affect the AB of Dragon Shape claws, but then I had some really bizarre outputs from the combat logs.

Here's some screenshots of some combat logs I've done in Dragon Shape Form with Skin of the Manticore (+6AC, Piercing Resist 15/-) before shifting. I've done two rounds against a dummy test ancient green dragon in the PGCC module. It doesn't look like the Piercing Resist will add to my AB sadly. But even still, its super confusing for me (mind you I am easily confused by NWN's mechanics). I'm using NWN EE (which shouldn't matter). Using flurry of blows.

Using the proper AB calculations it should be: Proper AB calculation for Dragon Shape : 24 (BAB) +23 (56 Str) +6 (Enchantment of your claws) -2 (Huge size) -2 (Flurry of blows) +1 (Epic Prowess) = 50AB. maybe 52AB for being in a wilderness area (not sure)

First round my Dragon had an AB progression of 44/41/44/41/38/35 - what the?
Second round my Dragon had an AB progression of 50/47/44/35/38/35. - looks better, the flurry attack seems to have copied the 35AB attack though and what happened to my AB 41 attack, used in the previous round?





Anyway I did another test, this time unequipping the Skin of the Manticore and using Robes of the White Magi (+5AC, Bonus feat Spell Penetration) and flurry of blows

First round my dragon had AB progression of 50/47/44/41/38/35 - this looks great
Second round my dragon had AB progression of 44/47/38/41/38/35 - what the?



Finally I decided to test it out without Flurry of Blows.

First round AB progression 46/43/46/43/40 - what the?
Second round AB progression 52/43/46/37/40 - looks better but what is with the 37 and where is the 49?
Third round AB progression 52/49/46/43/40 - this looks perfect, the right numbers and in the right order!



Anyway maybe the AB for Dragon Shape in reality is very strange. My second test had the right numbers in the right order on the first round, third test right numbers in the right order on the third round. I don't think I've encountered this problem when I have used a non-polymorphed build. If anyone else wants to have a play with the client and let me know it would be great. I thought you guys would find this interesting.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
This is talked about in tha latest thread. Dragon has 3 natural attacks. 2 claws which is +6 and a bite which is not. I have never found a pattern as to when the bite is chosen, but when it is you drop 6 AB and damage. From your testing you confirm what I always thought. Bite attacks hit totally random, but when they do, you suffer.

I did several runs with combat debugging on to determine both damage, AB and AC. your other slight deviances might come from whatever random things kick in. Sometimes, like flanking.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content: Thanks Grimnir! That makes total sense and its explained in the Wiki (https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Dragon_shape). Very interesting! Perhaps this is case closed then.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: First of all, having a DR item shouldn't affect your AB anyway. Second, in your first round of attacks you did have 50AB, it was the bite that dropped you for an instant (because it doesn't have an enchantment on it, which seriously should be fixed on EE). Thirdly & not relevant for this fight, but sometimes you'll see odd numbers on the combat log that might be from attacks of opportunity, cleave, etc. Lastly, take a look at the skin of the manticore, you see that charging ability? That's great, it is a (2d4+2) dexterity buff, which makes it really good for you. Always take advantage of these items if you can, they are great. Monk gloves with charging abilities, amulets, etc. hoard them all in a bag of holding, you never know when an item will be needed to give you that extra "push".

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Valerfor. It totally make sense. Whenever the first set of AB numbers come up which don't quite fit, its 6 less AB to what it should be it. 

For the first test
The first round of numbers is 50-6/47-6/44/41/38/35
The second round of numbers is 50/47/44/41-6/38/35

Second test
First round good
Second round 50-6/47/44-6/41/38/35 - I've checked the screen shot and done a typo for the third attack which I will fix

Third test
First round 52-6/49-6/46/43/40
Second round 52/49-6/46/43-6/40
Third round is good

I guess that means the bite attack doesn't penetrate Stoneskin/Greater Stoneskin etc  Edit -  the wiki says the bite attack does penetrate DR like a +6 weapon, without the AB bonus - apparently it is a function of the dragon's innate DR

For sure I'm definitely hanging onto that manticore item, I'd like some way to boost my dex up in shifted form for tough fights

Edit: I guess from the numbers I thought I would test the hypothesis that the bite attack occurs at rate of one in three.

First test
First round 2/6 bite attacks
Second round 1/6 bite attacks

Second test
First round 0/6 bite attacks
Second round 2/6 bite attacks

Third test
First round 2/5 bite attacks
Second round 2/5 bite attacks
Third round 0/5 bite attacks

= 3+2+4 = 9 bite attacks in total, over 12 + 12 +15 = 29 attacks
9/29 = 31% -> so roughly a one in three chance of a bite attack, which makes sense.

By the way I am humbled and grateful both you Valerfor and Grimnir knew the answer so quickly and responded so fast to my question.
